00026         const string PathDataParser::COMMANDS = "MmLlHhVvCcSsQqTtAaZz";
00027 
00028         /* Map filling. */
00029         map<char, PathCommandParser*> createCommandParsers()
00030         {
00031             map<char, PathCommandParser*> commandParsers;
00032 
00033             static APathCommandParser aPathCommandParser;
00034             commandParsers['a'] = &aPathCommandParser;
00035 
00036             static CPathCommandParser cPathCommandParser;
00037             commandParsers['c'] = &cPathCommandParser;
00038 
00039             static LPathCommandParser lPathCommandParser;
00040             commandParsers['l'] = &lPathCommandParser;
00041 
00042             static MPathCommandParser mPathCommandParser;
00043             commandParsers['m'] = &mPathCommandParser;
00044 
00045             static QPathCommandParser qPathCommandParser;
00046             commandParsers['q'] = &qPathCommandParser;
00047 
00048             static SPathCommandParser sPathCommandParser;
00049             commandParsers['s'] = &sPathCommandParser;
00050 
00051             static TPathCommandParser tPathCommandParser;
00052             commandParsers['t'] = &tPathCommandParser;
00053 
00054             static ZPathCommandParser zPathCommandParser;
00055             commandParsers['z'] = &zPathCommandParser;
00056 
00057             return commandParsers;
00058         }
00059 
00060         /* Map implementation. */
00061         map<char, PathCommandParser*> PathDataParser::commandParsers =
00062                 createCommandParsers();
00063 
00064         PathDataParser::PathDataParser(Path *path, const string &data)
00065         {
00066             this->path = path;
00067             this->data = data;
00068 
00069             currentComponent = 0;
00070             lastSegment = 0;
00071 
00072             matrix = path->getCompleteMatrix();
00073         }

00126         void PathDataParser::parse()
00127         {
00128             string::size_type start = data.find_first_of(COMMANDS);
00129             if(start == string::npos)
00130                 start = 0;
00131 
00132             string::size_type end = data.find_first_of(COMMANDS, start + 1);
00133 
00134             while(end != string::npos) {
00135                 command(data.substr(start, end - start));
00136                 start = end;
00137                 end = data.find_first_of(COMMANDS, start + 1);
00138             }
00139 
00140             /* Add last command. */
00141             command(data.substr(start));
00142         }
00143 
00144         void PathDataParser::command(const string &commandData)
00145         {
00146             char command = commandData[0];
00147             vector<string> splitted;
00148             vector<float> arguments;
00149             string argumentsData = commandData.substr(1);
00150 
00151             /* We have a little hacky solution here. We want to be able to
00152              * parse arguments in the form of
00153              * 123-456 as 123, -456
00154              * but also
00155              * 123e-456 as 123e-456
00156              * This is why we replace "-" by " -", but first we remove the
00157              * "e-" so those will not be affected.
00158              */
00159             replaceAll(argumentsData, "e-", "e#");
00160             replaceAll(argumentsData, "-", " -");
00161             replaceAll(argumentsData, "e#", "e-");
00162 
00163             split(argumentsData, ", ", splitted);
00164             for(vector<string>::iterator iterator = splitted.begin();
00165                     iterator != splitted.end(); iterator++) {
00166                 stringstream converter(*iterator);
00167                 float f;
00168                 converter >> f;
00169                 arguments.push_back(f);
00170             }
00171 
00172             map<char, PathCommandParser*>::iterator iterator =
00173                     commandParsers.find(lowerCommand(command));
00174 
00175             if(iterator != commandParsers.end()) {
00176                 PathCommandParser *commandParser = iterator->second;
00177                 commandParser->parse(path, command, this, arguments);
00178             } else {
00179                 LogManager::getInstance()->warning(
00180                         "%c path command is not implemented.", command);
00181             }
00182         }
00183 
00184         bool PathDataParser::isRelativeCommand(char command) const
00185         {
00186             return command >= 'a' && command <= 'z';
00187         }
00188 
00189         char PathDataParser::lowerCommand(char command) const
00190         {
00191             return (command >= 'a' && command <= 'z' ?
00192                     command : command - 'A' + 'a');
00193         }
00194 
00195         Vector2D PathDataParser::toAbsoluteSpace(char command,
00196                 const Vector2D &v) const
00197         {
00198             if(isRelativeCommand(command))
00199                 return v + currentPoint;
00200             else
00201                 return v;
00202         }
00203 
00204         Vector2D PathDataParser::toWorldSpace(const Vector2D &v) const
00205         {
00206             return matrix * v;
00207         }
00208     }
00209 }
